### Welcome to Kenia Soil Survey

The **Kenya Soil Survey (KSS)**, a department within [KALRO](https://www.kalro.org), provides authoritative soil information to support sustainable land management, agricultural planning, environmental monitoring, and national development.  
:::

Our mission is to generate, curate, and share high-quality soil data and knowledge for researchers, policymakers, farmers, and the public. On this site you can find:

## [Data](data/index.qmd)

Access datasets collected from soil survey missions across Kenya. Predicted distribution of soil properties (soil maps) and Soil health indicators, such as erosion risk, fertility, crop suitability. [Read more about data](data.qmd)

::: {#data}
:::



## [Reports](reports/index.qmd)

Learn about our methodologies and protocols through detailed documentation. [Read more about our soil data approach](docs.qmd)

::: {#reports}

## Our Commitment

The Kenya Soil Survey is committed to:
- Providing **open, high-quality soil information**  
- Supporting **evidence-based decision-making**  
- Advancing **soil science research** in Kenya  
- Enabling sustainable management of natural resources
